Name: Syphax – Lion of the Desert: The Battles of Tispara, 213, Siga & Tingis 212 BC
Description:
This is GMT's Battle Scenario for SPQR, published in RBM's C3i Magazine Nr. 20.

Midway through the Second Punic War, the Scipio brothers commanding Rome's forces in Spain decided to open a new front against Carthage in her own backyard. They convinced King Syphax of the Masaesulian Numidians to rise in revolt. The rebellion featured three major battles: at Tispasa, 213, Syphax led his new model Numidian army to victory over a punitive expedition dispatched from Carthage, then, at Siga, 212, Hasdrubal Barca retirned from Spain and joined with the young Masinissa to rout Syphax' growing army. Finally at Tingis, 212, Masinissa cornered the retreating Syphax in the far west and defeated his hastily raised levies. THree small, quick-playing scenarios are presennted here for your wargaming entertainment.


     Syphax Setup Card.
     23 new counters.


Expansion module for the Great Battles of History (GBoH) series game SPQR.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Great Battles of History (GMT Games)

Name: Nights of Fire: Battle for Budapest – Broadcast from the Radio Promo Card
Description:
Setup: Place this card next to the main board, as close to District 5A as possible.

Gameplay: When a Revolutionary player is taking a move action, for 1 ops they may move a single fighter between District 5A and the Radio card. Once a fighter is moved onto the Radio, it is immediately revealed (and stays revealed if it moves back to District 5A). As long as there is at least one fighter present, the Revolutionary player(s) gain 1 momentum at the end of each round (immediately before the Adjustment Phase), and each time a civilian is arrested.

Fighters on the card still count as units in District 5A and can be targeted by attacks while there. The card is removed from play when it first empties after at least one fighter was present on it.
Insurgents on the Radio are NOT hidden at the end of the round.
If playing against the Konev automated opponent, units on the Radio count double for the purposes of calculating threat, and are dealt damage to first.

For added thematic flair, as long as there is at least one insurgent on the Radio card, play Beethoven’s Egmont Overture very loudly.

When playing Days & Nights campaign mode (Red Army Pack expansion required), the Radio Broadcast is only available for play if the Making Pamphlets event on the Printing Press promo was solved in day 3-5.

The Radio Broadcast is supported both in Zhukov and Conflict modes, in any player counts.

Name: Days of Ire: Budapest 1956 – Printing Press Promo Card
Description:
Setup: Place this card next to the main board at the beginning of day 3, as close to Blaha Lujza Square as possible. Do not add any fighters to this location at setup.

Gameplay: This is a new location, pieces can move to the same as any other location on the board, but it is only adjacent to Blaha Lujza Square. It has a printed event that can be solved by the Revolutionary player(s) the same way as any other event. If
the event is solved, the location is removed from play (and its printed effect performed). If the event is not solved by the end of the game, it counts against the events on the board, and triggers its printed penalty effect.

The Printing Press is supported both in Zhukov and Conflict modes, in any player counts.

Name: If Mama Ain't Happy...
Description:
If Mama Ain't Happy...  The Game Where You "Win" by Wiping Out the Human Race.

If Mama Ain't Happy...   ...Ain’t Nobody Happy.

Tired of the trouble she’s had with Mankind, 
Mother Earth has decided to rid herself of the pesky critters by any means: Hurricanes, Earthquakes, Flurries…  Whatever It Takes!

But don’t write off humanity just yet. They react with Fear, Denial – even Recycling! You never know what they’ll come up with next!

To "Win", be the first player to reduce your population of pesky bipeds to zero by playing Disasters against yourself. Prevent your opponents from doing the same by playing Reactions against them.

Special instructions allow you to Combine, Steal or Discard Disasters and in some cases even turn your opponent's plays against them.

Who said extinction can't be fun?

—description from the designer

Name: Monopoly Pizza Game
Description:
In Monopoly Pizza Game, players move around the game board trying to buy as many types of pizza as they can, from pepperoni to spinach to mushroom. Instead of buying properties or collecting rent, players aim to collect a color set that corresponds to a type of pizza, such as veggie lovers, barbecue chicken, or even mac and cheese. A full set of flavors combines to make an awesome new pizza, giving those cards a higher value.

At the end of the game, the player who collects the most pizza slices wins!

Name: Fußball-Skat
Description:
The game map pictures a soccer field. The players have to move a ball on a grid into the opposite goal. The movement of the ball is determined by a deck of 60 cards. Each player has a hand of 8 cards to choose from. After a card is played, it is discarded and another is drawn.

The first half of the game ends, when the deck is played through once and the second half ends when the deck is played through a second time.

This game was published in the 1950s.

—user summary

Name: Don't Flip a Ninja
Description:
A card matching game in which players are guards trying to prevent ninjas from infiltrating the castle.

Each turn, players will flip two of the face-down cards in the courtyard grid. If those two cards make a match (or a combo) the player must follow the instructions for that match/combo.

Players lose if the ninja pawn makes it all the way to the castle or if they take 4 wounds. Players win if they can capture 4 of the ninja cards.

It's a game of simple mechanics but thoughtful strategy for gamers of any level.

—description from the designer

Name: Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon – Red Death Expansion
Description:
With the Red Death add-on campaign, you now have another option. You may play it after finishing any of the other three large campaigns, and take your favorite heroes on a last, one-way mission to mysterious Homelands. Their ship will slip into the mists separating Avalon from our reality, and spend many weeks traversing the border between the worlds. Finally, it will emerge back in Homelands, many years after the plague, where answers to some ultimate questions lie buried under the rubble of desolated cities.

What happened here after most humans departed for Avalon?  

     Is it safe to return?  
     What caused the plague?  
     How did Arthur learn about the island of Fore-dwellers?  
     What secrets did he leave behind? 


Red Death is an expert-level expansion campaign for Tainted Grail. It contains 32 dangerous Location cards that allow you to visit a part of a kingdom ravaged by plague, where unspeakable horrors still lurk among the ruins. These horrors won’t be your only problem! The ancient undersea empire of Fomoria already surveys the lands abandoned by humans, while brutish Picts of the north, who somehow built resistance to the disease, raid the ruins looking for treasure, magic – and something more sinister. Then, there are solitary survivors who outlasted the plague. They’re often mad and dangerous, but their knowledge may help heroes survive.

Pick your allies and enemies, solve difficult riddles, navigate ruins of the old world and face some of the hardest Encounters created for Tainted Grail. And if you survive, learn things that will put the main storyline of three campaigns in a new light.

This add-on campaign will contain approximately 15-30 hours of gameplay grouped into an 8-chapter story. Just like our base campaigns it offers multiple endings and branching paths, so you can try to solve it in a different way multiple times!

Extended Character Advancement
Naturally, a large amount of additional gameplay meant we had to extend the Character progression. That’s why the box also includes new and exciting Advanced Abilities that can help you upgrade your Attributes even further!

Not to mention that many artifacts or items found in Homelands are much more powerful than anything found on Avalon.

—description from the publisher

Name: Taking Stock
Description:
You are a stock market investor who is looking to get the most out of your money.  Buy low and try to control the market to gain you the most victory points!

Everyone starts out with the same ten numbered cards and uses these to bid on stocks.  Bids are collected each round and stock prices change based on the total amount bid for each stock.  Stock values, using VPs as currency, rise with high total bids on that stock.  However, bidding low actually wins you the stock itself.

After 6 rounds the stock values in your portfolio are calculated and whoever has the most VPs wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Pegasus Garden
Description:
Pegasus Garden is a dexterity or "kinetic" game of card flipping and set creation. The theme is a garden party for mythological unicorns and winged horses. From 2-4 players may play the game and it takes about 10 minutes per player to complete. The goal is to get as many of your faction's beasts to the party safely. Players take turns flipping or dropping their cards onto the play field, attempting to create sets of their faction that will score points. Players may build their own score or attempt to foil their opponents by changing/removing their opponent's sets. Along the way, party goers may help each other get to the party, or perhaps get distracted by pretty butterflies and miss the party altogether.

—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Serval: Expeditionary Warfare in Central Africa
Description:
Operation Serval is a wargame of the campaign in Mali in West Africa during 2012 and 2013, which saw Islamist forces seize control of the northern part of the country and then threaten the capital at Bamako. A French expeditionary force intervened, counterattacked, and along with various African allies, routed the Islamists in a short and sharp campaign.

This is a two-player game where one player commands the French Coalition and the other player the Islamists. Each side's forces include several contingents of allied forces. Both sides' objective is to gain control of Mali.

The central game mechanism is Command Control Points (C2P). C2P are a quantification of each side's ability to coordinate operations and conduct intelligence. Players expend C2P to recruit units, activate contingents, and perform logistics. The game has two scenarios: one deals with the entire campaign; the other with the French intervention.

Each hex is about 50 kilometers across. Each turn represents anywhere from one week of intense combat to a month or two of refitting and regrouping. Ground units represent companies, battalions and groups of irregulars (anywhere from 100 to 500 fighters). Airstrikes represent the effect of sorties (from 4 to 16 aircraft). Netwar markers provide cybernetic operations, terrorism, ISR and drone strikes.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Conflicts against the Islamic State

Name: Desert One War: US in the Persian Gulf, 1979-81
Description:
Originally published in Modern War magazine #44 (Nov-Dec 2019).

Desert One War: US in the Persian Gulf, 1979-81 - is a hypothetical operational level two player wargame covering US and allied intervention in the Persian Gulf during the 1970s and 1980s. The game has several scenarios. Two scenarios cover a US invasion of Iran in the aftermath of the Iranian Hostage Crisis of 1979-81. A third scenario covers an Oil War situation, where the US leads a NATO effort to seize Persian Gulf oilfields in response to an oil embargo.

The game system models ground, air and amphibious operations. For the Allies, the central game system is Air Transport Points (ATP). These represent strategic airlift capability. The assumption is that the scenarios cover the opening stage of an intervention, before the US can mobilize full-scale sealift. Therefore, airlift will become the primary means for moving units into the theater and provide logistic support.

The opposing Opposition Forces (OPFOR) have a better logistical situation since they can rely on local supply. But many of their military units are erratic in performance. This is modeled by untried units and other game functions.
 Each hex on the map represents 60 kilometers from side to side. Each turn of play represents anything from three days of intense combat to ten days of refitting. Ground units represent regiments, brigades, divisions and groups of irregulars. Special operations forces (SOF) represents unconventional warfare activities. Aircraft units represent anything from one to four squadrons, depending on the quality of air force and operational tempo.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle Hymn Vol. 2: Shiloh and Bentonville
Description:
Battle Hymn: Volume Two is the long-anticipated sequel game release to Volume One and includes two complete games: Shiloh and Bentonville. Battle Hymn is the new brigade-level system based upon the latest research into Civil War combat. This new entry introduces a new solitaire system to the series and an extension map for Gettysburg (Volume One) for a complete alternative history of the entire battle. Designed by Charles S. Roberts Award-winning designer Eric Lee Smith.

Shiloh: The First Great Battle depicts the two-day battle of Shiloh. The Confederate army surprises the Union forces of General Grant and a fierce battle blazes for two days, with first the Confederate on the offensive and then the Union turning to the attack on the second day. Shiloh shocked to the nation. Left dead or injured were more men than in all of America’s previous wars combined. The game includes four scenarios.

Bentonville: The Last Great Battle simulates the final major battle of the war. Sherman is marching through North Carolina when a surprise attack by the much-weakened Army of Tennessee catches one wing of the US army exposed. The first day ends in a bloody stalemate, and continues on for two more days. Can the Confederates escape? This game has both two-player and solitaire scenarios, and introduces an innovative new solitaire system to the game series.

Bonus One—Gettysburg ’62: No Lost Orders depicts an alternative history—the Confederates do not lose their orders for the 1862 invasion, Antietam never happens, and Jeb Stuart’s cavalry begins the battle of Gettysburg with a major engagement south of the Round Tops. The battle grows as a Union corps arrives to face off with Heth’s Division.

Bonus Two—the Gettysburg extension map attaches to Gettysburg: The Tide Turns making for a complete alternative history of the entire battle. Plus, a new scenario explores the alternative that Pickett’s Charge never happens; instead the Confederates drive south around the Round Tops on their way to Baltimore.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ja Nein Rammstein
Description:
Nobody can fool you when it comes to Rammstein music, live concerts, videos and other interesting details and facts about the band?! With this quiz game you can prove your Rammstein knowledge and literally compete with your friends.

The quiz game contains 400 questions about Rammstein in German and English for 2-6 players aged 16 and over.

Spiel mit mir!

—description from the publisher

Name: Our Sputnik
Description:
This Russian board game was released in 1961 by the Moscow publishing house "Detsky Mir" ("Child World" in Russian) with a circulation of 50,000 copies. The outer box shows a satellite resembling the Russian Sputnik 3 in orbit around Earth.

The game board consists of the Earth centrally located. A pin protrudes out of the Earth. On the pin sits a flat cardboard disk that has various sized holes punched through it. The disk represents outer space around Earth and is spun to play the game, producing a 3 dimensional playing board.

The game includes a springboard (rocket base) and 2 balls (satellites).

As the rotating disk spins players "launch satellites" one by one. They receive small chips if their "satellite" comes to rest in the punched out holes.

Players receive 3 chips, if their satellite comes to rest in the smallest holes. 2 chips if they can land in a middle sized hole and 1 chip if a player lands their satellite in the largest holes. The winner is the player with the largest number of chips  after a nominated time or first to a set number (i.e. 10).

—user summary

Name: Guardians: Uprising
Description:
Guardians: Uprising is a 33-card "Hero Pack" expansion for Guardians that includes four new heroes — Atrivoxx, Chamber, Pandora, Nightshade — each with their own distinct set of cards and abilities.

Each hero includes a full power deck and Ultimate card, which can be added to your collection and drafted into new Guardians decks. Additionally, these new heroes are the first to use the powerful Blast Damage ability, which can deal damage to multiple enemy heroes at once.

Name: Tony's Treasures
Description:
You are elite collectors trying to win the most pieces at Tony's illicit street sale of 1960's objet's d'art.

Buy as many items as you can without spending the most money, as the police could be here any minute.

A 9-card auction-style microgame.

Remove one card without looking at it. Write down and enter sealed bids on each subsequent card as it is turned over. The highest bid wins the card. There is no limit to what you can bid, but if the police card is turned, then whoever has paid most is eliminated. After that the winner of the most cards wins with the value of those cards serving as a tie breaker.

—description from the publisher


Released in the October 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

A limited special members-club release and a print & play 2017 16-card editions were available before official publishing by Button Shy.


COMPONENTS

Button Shy 9-card edition

     8 Auction Item cards
     1 Police card


16-card editions

     13 Auction Item cards
     3 Police cards



Auction Items

     Inverted Jenny Stamp
     Bottle of Lafite Wine
     Faberge Egg
     Flowing Hair Dollar Coin
     Qianlong Dynasty Vase
     Stradivarious Violin
     Painting by Picasso
     Baseball Trading Card


16-card first edition only:

     "La Peregrina" Pearl Necklace
     1957 Ferrari
     Codex Leicester Book
     Silk Isfahan Persian Carpet
     Statue by Giacometti
Families: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

Name: TRITT Reloaded
Description:
TRITT RELOADED is a reimplementation of TRITT, that was solved in 2009.

This new set of rules fixes the problem and also changes the game experience completely, as now lines of 3 or more dots can only be created as a result of a tritton movement. It also includes more pieces than its predecessor.

COMPONENTS

A hexagonal board with 91 connected dots.
20 trittons (10 of each type).
Carrying case.

RULES

The game begins with an empty board.

Each player has an allocated colour (Orange or Blue) and takes all the trittons that have their colour in the middle.

The Orange player starts the game by entering one of his trittons somewhere on the board. The three dots of the tritton must be placed over 3 free aligned dots on the board.

From now on, and starting with the Blue player, players in turn must do these 2 things in order:

     Legally enter one of his trittons on the board.
     (Optional) Move an opponent’s tritton (if any) any number of steps along the line it is laying on.
     It is forbidden to enter a tritton on the board so that a line of 3 or more dots of the same colour is created. Lines of 3 or more dots can only be created as a result of a tritton movement.


As a rule of the thumb, you place trittons that have your colour in the middle, and move those that have your colour on the sides.

END OF GAME

The game ends in one of the following cases:

One player wins by making a line of three (or more) dots of his colour but not making a line of at least three dots of the opponent’s colour at the same time.

One player loses by making a line of three dots of the opponent’s colour.

One of the players loses by not being able to make a legal action.

The game ends in a tie at any moment if both players agree.

-description from designer

Name: Harem Wars: Negligee Add-on Deck
Description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Contained 50 cards.

Name: Harem Wars: Army Gals Add-on Pack
Description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Contained 50 cards.

Name: Harem Wars: Battle Girls Add-on Pack
Description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Contained 45 cards.

Name: Harem Wars: Galaxy Girls Add-on Deck
Description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Contains 50 cards.

Name: すごくすごいヨガ (Hyper Super Yoga)
Harem Wars: Love Stories Expansion Set
Description: Add on deck of unique cards for 'Harem Wars. Large expansion contains over 100 cards.

Name: Fright House
Description:
Build and run your own haunted house in this worker placement/tile placing hybrid game.

Get together with up to three of your friends and compete to see who can build the best and scariest haunted house and frighten the most guests without accidentally scaring them to death. There's plenty of player interaction as you can connect your houses up to theirs, swap guests from their queues to yours, raise and lower the fear level of various guests with effects cards - all to keep players on their toes and ruin the most well laid of plans.

Your workers can head into town to research new house tiles, recruit more workers, promote their house and attract guests, or collect the necessary resources to build their house.

The workers also double as scarers! They can head into the house to help scare guests in the correct directions or they can work the queue at the front-of-house to prime guests for a more frightening experience. But be careful! Many guests have special attributes that can throw a wrench in things like "Screamer" - this guest will raise the fear level of every adjacent guest when they become scared! Use these different abilities to play guests off one another or interrupt other player's plans.

The only way to get cash is by admitting people to your house, they pay the second they come in whether they have a good time or not. As a guest enters, you'll slot them into a standee base with a rotating dial to track their fear level.

If guests have a good time, you can invite them to come back. If guests die, they take up precious storage bays and prevent you from storing the necessary resources to build up your house. If you kill too many guests, it means a change of management and a huge loss of points.

The gameplay goes on a night-by-night basis for 7 days leading up to halloween, resetting and paying workers at the end of each night. As the game wraps up after all the guests leave on Halloween night, Euro-style rules kick in and players reveal secret values each of their successfully scared guests contribute to their total score.

Spook House is a complex game with multiple strategies to win, currently clocking in around 3 hours for a full playthrough with four players. But it's still very early in development.

—description from the designer

Name: Western Legends: Ante Up
Description:
As the territories expand westward, untold fortune awaits those eager to write their name across the face of history. Some will become legends with a revolver in hand, while others will gamble their way to infamy. 

Ante Up is the first big box expansion to the award-winning, Western Legends. The Western Legends: Ante Up expansion raises the stakes with new features such as the mini-game Faro, a train that travels the boards for unlawful players to rob, and much more. Ante Up also adds new characters, items, Man in Black cards, and Poker cards to mix or replace content from the original game.

Name: Harem Wars: Echo Tokyo Add-on Pack
Description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Expansion contains 10 cards.

Name: Harem Wars: Beach Bounce – Add-on Deck
Description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Expansion contains of 100 cards.

Name: Harem Wars: Alexa's Wild Night Add-on Set
Description: Add on deck of unique cards for Harem Wars. Expansion contains of over 50 cards.

Name: Sakko
Description: Traditional symmetrical two-player game known from Sami areas of Norway since at least the nineteenth century, but may be significantly older. It might ulimately share roots with backgammon and/or pachisi. Each player has an even number of pawns (12 and 14 are known), the board has three rows each with one space more than the number of pawns (13 or 15). A larger king piece starts out neutral, but when captured becomes part of the capturing player’s army. It can be captured back and forth, but will never return to being neutral. It uses two or three four-sided dice (cubes with two opposing sides elongated into pyramids so the die can’t rest on them), marked I, II, III and X.

Name: Overlords of Infamy: Misery Loves Company
Description:
Overlords of Infamy: Misery Loves Company expands the Overlords of Infamy base game by adding in new Evil Overlords, new archetypes for the Adventuring Hero that change their play style, and a sixth player in the form of Huff, the Tragic Dragon!

In addition to the above, Overlords of Infamy: Misery Loves Company includes new Nefarious Plots, Hero Quests and World Events that can be combined with those in the base game. With Spjarkle the Valkyrie, Pancakes the Cat, The Marauding Dark Knight, Monsieur Beaveraux and Steve, the Intolerable Roommate all joining in on the chaos, you're sure to have a unique experience every game!

Name: Jotunheim
Description:
Need to retrieve Mjolnir from the giants?  Must be Thursday.
        Need to retrieve Freyja from the giants?  Must be Friday.
        Two retrieval teams ensorceled to think the other is actually giants?
        Just another day in Jotunheim.


Jotunheim is an asymmetric abstract game with Norse myth-themed variable player powers.  The object is to trap your opponent so that they have no legal moves (or, conversely, to avoid being trapped as long as possible).  Your pieces need to keep moving and the board quickly fills with blocks, forcing you towards the endgame.

Each player has a power based on a mythological character, creature or artifact.  They have one prize and two rescuers.  Each turn they must move their prize (leaving a block behind) then one of the rescuers (which then builds on or excavates from a neighbouring space).  Since pieces can't move up more than one level and spaces become blocked off, one player will eventually run out of legal moves and lose -- usually when their prize is trapped by a combination of pieces and terrain.

—description from the designer

Name: Incantris: Wizard Design Kit
Description:
This was a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion. Only 550 were made.
—user summary

The Wizard Design Kit gives you full control over your Incantris team for a more advanced experience.


    12 additional wizard miniatures, which gives you each wizard type in all 4 colors (blue, red, purple, grey)



    Try different combinations of wizards to find your most lethal team.



    Customize your wizards by choosing which spells to equip them with.


—description from the publisher

Name: Xadram
Description:
Xadram is a war game in the same vein of War, its most successful rival in Brazilian market. However, Xadram introduces new concepts and mechanics to the formula, like:


    card-driven battle modifiers;
     moving units by the sea;
     hidden units;
     towers (the player who loses the territory with his tower is eliminated);
     6 leagues + neutral territories;


The game's objective is conquest four leagues entirely or eliminate all other players. There's no objective cards. However it uses 6 dices (3 for attack and 3 for defense), just like War.

—user summary

Name: Bakugan Battle Planet: Battle Brawlers
Description: The goal of the game is to deal damage to your opponent until they run out of cards. Turns are simultaneous. A round begins with a card draw, then each player may play a card face-down as an energy card. Then, players roll their Bakugan (spheres which transform via a magnet) at the hide matrix, a series of metallic tiles each of which is referred to a Baku-core. Brawls are resolved by comparing BP with ties determined by flipping a card, with the higher cost breaking the tie. The winner will the deal damage to the opponent based on its damage value. Cards may be played at almost anytime.

Name: Last Stand: Fantasy & Semi-Historical Miniatures Wargame Rules
Description:
Miniatures wargame rules for any semihistorical or fictional setting where close combat remains important (so including many forms of soft science fiction alongside typical fantasy).

Unrelated to any particular setting or range of miniatures, Last Stand divide all troops into a number of generic troop types amalgamating equipment, tactics, morale, etc. An army will contain about 25-60 stands of troops depending on types. Stands can be of different sizes but it is recommended that both sides stick to the same.

Sequence of play is an unusual continuous model rather than the more traditional fixed and repetitious order of conducting events.

The rules are aimed primarily at one-on-one play but solo, pairs, or teams play is possible.

Name: Battle Valor Fantasy: A Game of 15mm Fantasy Warfare
Description: A 200+ page rulebook packed full of everything you need to play this 15mm Fantasy Scale Mass Combat Tabletop Game. It also includes complete descriptions of all 33 Races that can be found in the World of Legian, as well as a complete Bestiary of every available unit for all 33 Armies.

Name: 4 Letter Words
Description:
4 Letter Words is the  fun, strategic card game in which you connect cards, as you try to create the most words, and score the most points, possible!

How To Play
Select a player to keep score for each participant, as the game progresses, buy use of a writing instrument and a piece of paper. Next, shuffle the deck, deal each player 5 cards, and set it face down. Draw 1 card and place it face-up in the centre of the playing area. The player left of the dealer has the first turn.

For each turn, a player may place any card held on an open side of any card on the playing surface that create a 4 letter word, in a grid that expands in any direction, which scores the player points on the card played. If multiple words are created by the play, the card's score is multiplied by the number of words made. Thereafter, the player may play additional card, up to all 5 held at the beginning of the turn. The total score earned on all cards played is multiplied by the number of cards played, as a bonus. All cards played during a turn must be linked by at least one side. All words created must be found on the "4 Letter Word List" card.

To end a turn, the player draws cards to replenish his or her hand to a total of 5. If a player is unable to play even a single card, the turn is forfeited. Play continues clockwise until all cards have been placed.

The player with the highest score wins!

Name: Quarrelsome Creatures
Description:
How To Play
Shuffle the deck and deal each player a hand of 11 cards. Set the remaining cards aside.

Each trick (or turn) of the game consists of every player placing 1 card into the middle of the playing surface, in clockwise order.

The player to the dealer's left begins the game.

For each trick, the first card played must be one of the game's 8 suits– cat, zombie, werewolf, witch, vampire, ghost, monster or mummy. Subsequent cards played in a trick must follow suit, unless a player does not have a card of said suit, or holds a special (!) card (which may be played instead). The player with the highest value card played, of the dominant suit, takes the trick. Players score 1 point for every card of any type taken, as well as bonus/penalty points listed on special cards.

The trick taker begins the next turn. Special cards cannot be used to start a trick. If the player starting a trick has only special cards to play, all remaining tricks of the hand are void, along with that player being assessed a -15 point penalty.

The first player to 100 points, wins!

Name: Jersey Shore Family Vacation: The Game
Description: Jersey Shore Family Vacation: The Game "engages consumers with trivia based on iconic moments and sayings" from the television show of the same name, according to the publisher.

Name: Roku-Roku Shogi
Description:
Roku-Roku Shogi means 6-6 Shogi and is a Shogi variant using a 6x6 board and 12 standard shogi pieces for each player: 6 Pawns, 1 King, 1 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Knight, 1 Lance, and either 1 Rook or 1 Bishop.

Pawns start at second and fifth rank.
Players take turns placing their non-pawn pieces, one at a time, at the first and sixth rank, respectively.

When all pieces are on board (and the left over Bishops or Rooks are returned to the box) play starts according to standard Shogi rules.

Published 31th July 2018 in newspapers and the web in in Tendo, Yamagata Prefecture, Japan. 
Designed by the Tendo branch of the Japan Shogi Association in cooporation with Prof. Michio Matsuda.

For anyone further interested in Roku-Roku Shogi google:  
66 å°†æ£‹
or
ã‚ãã‚ã å°†æ£‹

Name: DEKU
Description:
DEKU is a party game that comes with two stand-up artist model figures, a die, words and phrases on cards, and multiple blocks. You use the box to create a double-sided stage of sorts, with teams facing one another and a wall on the stage between the teams.

In a round, someone rolls the die, then one player on each team starts trying to recreate the word or phrase using the artist model figure and any number of blocks. Once one person is finished, they count from 10 to 0, then the other player must stop. They then rotate the stage to show their creation to their other teammates, who try to guess what the person was trying to represent.

Name: I Got This!
Description:
Get ready to bounce, toss, balance, roll, hop, and laugh!

It's up to you to match your confidence with your competence as you lay it all on the line to prove you can complete the challenges and rack up the most points over nine rounds of play.

The first player rolls the die and then reads aloud the corresponding challenge card. "Flick the button through the ring!"

First, everyone marks a check by the number of points they want to try and win.

Feeling confident? Check nine points. Not so much? Check one point. Feeling like you can conquer the world? Why not play the I Got This card to double your potential points?

Once all the score cards are marked - Start flicking, tossing, balancing, measuring, guestimating, or whatever else the challenge entails.

Successfully complete the challenge? Woohoo! You get to circle the number you marked and keep it as points at the end of the game!

Things didn't go quite as planned? You'll have to cross out that number and cut your losses - OR, if you're convinced all you need is just one more try, you COULD use your Do Over card.

But be careful! You can only use it once!

Keep on playing through the nine rounds of ego-humbling challenges. Once every number on everyone's cards is either circled or crossed out, add up your points and announce your scores.

The player with the most points wins!

Fun, funny, and challenging in ways you've never imagined, I Got This is sure to become an instant family game night favorite.

—description from the publisher

Name: Eternal Kings: Survival
Description: This is the first Eternal Kings expansion pack. You will have access to advanced pawns, rooks, knights, bishops, and ability cards for each of the 4 realms. Use these cards to customize your army and ability deck in the most unique of ways!

Name: Eternal Kings: Mercenaries
Description:
This is an expansion for the Eternal Kings base game. You will have access to new pawns, rooks, knights, and bishops that can use any of the four disciplines! Use these cards to customize your army in the most unique of ways!

—description from the designer

Name: Disney Song Challenge
Description:
In this game, players have to sing songs about their favorite Disney movies.
One player player the role of the judge and, each turn, flip a card with the name of a Disney movie on it. The other players have to be fast and the first one to stand up and sing a song from that movie wins the point. If the judge thinks the song is not complete enough to win the point, he spin the wheel and the singing player will have a additional challenge to complete to earn the point. Then the next player in clockwise order becomes the judge and the turn starts over again. The game ends once a player reaches 5 points.

—user summary

Name: Space Freaks: Liquidator – The 29th Head Promo Card
Description:
Promo card from the Man vs. Meeple Season 2 Kickstarter Campaign.

Liquidator

States that Freaks gain Plus 2 to attacks when using sponsor cards

Name: Everyday Player Football
Description: Everyday Player Football is a football simulation game. Based on the old Vince Lombardi Football game, many new facets have been added to more accurately represent each player's skills. Players are individually rated to create team offensive and defensive ratings. These are compared to an opponent to generate ratings for that current game. Dice drive all play results, and the game has rules for solitaire play.

Name: Ghosts of the Moor: New Tasks
Description:
New tasks: 3 bonus points for collecting depicted tiles.

The heart of the Moor: 5 bonus points if you has this “treasure” at the end of the game, but can be stolen from you during the game.

Contained in spielbox 7/2018 edition.

Name: Flight to the Moon
Description:
Post war Soviet space game from 1955 where players land on the moon and return to earth with rockets and a limited fuel supply. The game consists of a board, cardboard rockets and fuel tanks and a dice.

Players roll a dice and move cardboard rockets along a path. During the journey players maybe penalised for landing where a cosmic phenomena occurs or at a space station. Detours are in place but maybe avoided by sacrificing a fuel tank.

Players have a select numbered of spots to descend down to the moon otherwise they continue to orbit the moon until they land on the correct spot. A fuel tank is needed to land and take off. Players can land on the dark side of the moon but will miss a turn.

The return journey to earth has some detours to navigate around and upon earth re-entry (Number 74) if a player has no more fuel tanks then they must wait for another player to pass and tow them to earth.

The winner is the player to return to earth first after landing on the moon.

—user summary

Name: Talk, You Fiend!
Description:
Acting as a hired torturer for the Mad King, the goal of "Talk, You Fiend!" is to be the best at your job by inflicting as much pain as possible on the prisoners by choosing to play varying levels of pain cards. Compete against other players to see who is the best at the job, but be careful not to overdo it as the prisoner can only collectively take so pain much before breaking.

If the prisoner survives, the player with the highest pain card wins the prisoner, the points, and the round. If the prisoner breaks then be ready to collect the dreaded "Shame Token". Out-wit and bluff your competitors to see who is the best torturer. The first player to reach 10 points wins the game!

-description from the publisher

Name: Werwölfe Vollmondnacht: Nachwuchs-Gerber
Description:
This is a promo item for Werwölfe Vollmondnacht (One Night Ultimate Werewolf) containing the Junior Tanner character given out for free in Essen 2018.

In those trying times being a tanner was not easy. Still, there was one individual who wanted to take over and get rid of his master once and for all ...

Flow of the game:
The apprentice tanner can be combined with any of the roles from the main game or its expansions. Depending on whether the tanner from "One Night Ultimate Werewolf" is used the apprentice tanner's role during the game changes.

Rules of play:
(apprentice tanner, wakes up at night **)

The apprentice tanner is called during the night phase and opens his eyes. The tanner, with eyes closed, lifts his thumb so his apprentice can identify him.

If the tanner is in the game:
The apprentice wants to take over the tanner's job. He wins if the tanner is lynched during the vote (Should that be the case, the tanner also wins).

If the tanner is not in the game:
(because the card has not been drawn or has not been used)
The apprentice tanner has already taken over the role of his master and has realized that being a tanner is not as fulfilling as he expected ... like his predecessor he wins if he's lynched during the vote.

Name: Mixed Company
Description:
Mixed Company is a conversationally engaging card game.

How to Play:

1) Create Your Question Card Deck
Choose from Question Cards  including All Ages, 16+, NSFW, or other expansion packs, to put together a variety of questions for your group.

2) Deal out the cards
Deal out Question Cards, Trophy Cards, Action Cards, Challenge Cards, and Vote Cards to each player.

3) Choose Questions
Each player puts out one of their Question Cards  and then uses their Vote Cards to vote for the question they want to talk about.

4) Question Round
Have your conversation! You can choose to use only the top pick from the selected Question Cards  or go for three rounds. During the Conversation Phase for each Question Card you’ll play your Action Cards and Challenge Cards. After each Conversation Phase, you’ll award a Trophy Card.

5) Wrap Up
If you need to know who “won”, count up your points and see who got the most points.

Free Print and Play:

Name: 王様ゲーム (Game of Kings)
Description:
User summary
çŽ‹æ§˜ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ  (Game of Kings) is a Japanese card game.

You are descendants of the oldest noble family who founded the current kingdom. Sometimes as a common priest, sometimes wielding authority as a king, it is your destiny to live in the kingdom cycling through prosperity and decline.

Will you gain the most wealth in the raging waves of fate, and leave the best legacy?

Name: 関ヶ原 (Sekigahara)
Description:
User summary
é–¢ãƒ¶åŽŸ (Sekigahara) is a drafting & bluffing game between the East and West Army.

Deciding which cards to pick from the hand is important; whether to pick a card with the same army, simply choosing a big number, or choosing an enemy card. There are many choices and strategies.
 At this time, remember who picks cards that you did not choose.  Your memory will have a great impact on the bluff battle held after the draft.

Sekigahara is a dense game packed with many mechanics, but it still a quick game, lasting only 4 bids.

Name: Cruciverbalist
Description:
In Cruciverbalist, each player takes on the role of a freelance crossword puzzle crafter. You have to make the best crossword puzzle in order to have your puzzle get published and for you to get paid!

Cruciverbalist is played over 5 to 7 rounds, depending on the number of players. Each round, players will roll 12 dice.  With these dice, you will be able to use the conversion table to pick letters and create words to add to your crossword puzzle.  Other players also get actions on your turn!  Four of the dice are, "shared," and other players may use these dice to form words to add to their own crossword puzzles.  In this way, all players can be engaged during each players turn.

Stymied by your roll?  That's ok, you can use a helper token to reroll your dice, but you do lose the helper token and those are worth points at the end of the game!

Cruciverbalist is won by collecting the most points, and points are awarded for larger words, longest chain of letters, and staying within the topic of the crossword puzzle.  For example, you could put the word "car" in a crossword about animals, but that will cost you points!

Collect the most points and win the title of Champion Cruciverbalist!

This is a roll and write game that was an entry in the 2017 GenCant roll and write contest and received an honorable mention.

Name: わんわんわんだふる (Pooch Pooch Promenade)
Description:
ã‚ã‚“ã‚ã‚“ã‚ã‚“ã ãµã‚‹ (which is pronounced "Wanwan wanda furu" and which translates to Pooch Pooch Promenade) is a Japanese game in which players manipulate a "pooch pyramid".

On your turn, you play one of your two hand cards to move dogs up or down the pyramid, then you replenish your hand. At the end of the game, players score for the dogs they have in their hand and points are scored based on the position of the dogs in the pyramid.

Name: The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Cold War
Description:
The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Cold War is an expansion for The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire.

After the bombs fell on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, and the dust settled from World War II, the nations of the world rebuilt their economies and infrastructure, and the atomic age began. Nations forged alliances through strong diplomacy. They built rockets and satellites and began the space race. They constructed enough nuclear missiles to destroy the world many times over. Their spies were around every corner. The Cold War had begun.

The Cold War Expansion from Minion Games adds new levels of strategy and options to The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire. This expansion requires that game specifically, and not other products in the Manhattan Project game line. The various components in this expansion are divided into separate modules. It is recommended that these modules be added to Energy Empire gradually and not all at once.

Players may pick and choose the modules they like best to customize their game, or even choose to eventually add all of the modules to their game.

Players will find that the Cold War expansion adds many more opportunities for player interaction, and creates many more varied ways to win. Fans will notice that some of the things they are used to doing in Energy Empire might become more difficult, but the new strategic options and paths to victory greatly enhance replayability.

Name: Novice Novice Table Talk Role Playing Game
Description:
Novi Novi TRPG is like a tabletop RPG in a box - you can sit down without preparation or a game master and start playing right away.

First everyone picks a character card. Then the first GM picks a scene card and reads it to the scene player, and then roleplay the scene, typically ending with an ability test. Depending on how the scene is resolved the scene player gets a Light or Dark card added to their character and then the GM and scene player cards move to the next players. After three passes around the table you draw a conclusion card and figure out how your story ends.

Novi Novi is designed to be a lighthearted introduction to roleplaying for newcomers or an easy-to-use alternative for seasonsed roleplayers.

—user summary

Name: Novice Novice TRPG The Horror
Description:
In the second game in the Novi Novi TRPG series, the setting has changed from fantasy to horror and a number of small changes have been made to make play even smoother.

One change is that before the first scene you'll draw a prologue card to explain how all your characters have come together. After that it's the classic Novi Novi cycle of drawing and role-playing through scene cards until the Climax.

Other editions in this game are single-player rules and skull icons on some of the Scene cards that mark which ones can be easily combined with other Novi Novi games.

—user summary

Name: チクタク・デブリーズ (Chikutaku Debries)
Description:
Publisher's summary
ãƒã‚¯ã‚¿ã‚¯ãƒ»ãƒ‡ãƒ–ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚º (Chikutaku Debries) is a Japanese game.

Collect the dust of the universe. The construction of a space mansion has begun. Hurry, pioneers of the universe! Rooms are first come, first served.

The universe is full.

ãƒã‚¯ã‚¿ã‚¯ãƒ»ãƒ‡ãƒ–ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚º (Chikutaku Debries) is a game of competing to become the pioneer of the universe and to be the first to live in the space mansion built in zero gravity.

The desires of the settlers are intermingled, and the rooms become more and more complicated. Move through the space mansion well and push other characters to outer space.

Name: Novice Novice TRPG Steampunk
Description:
The latest entry in the Novi Novi series is Steampunk! Carrying over all the additions of The Horror, this adds a few new features. One of those is the addition of cards you can roll on to generate goals, mysteries, machines, and items.

For the unfamiliar, Novi Novi TRPG is like a tabletop RPG in a box. Using just cards and your imagination, you roleplay through a series of scenes until you reach the conclusion. Unlike a traditional RPG, the GM rotates every scene and there's no need for preparation.

—user summary

Name: Categorickell
Description:
A general knowledge tug-of-war!

2 teams race to name a thing in the category, starting with either letter on a newly-flipped card! The winner flips the card one ‘step’ closer to their side and covers the previous card, so the next visible card is closer to whoever was first. It’s like a tug-of-war: flip the card at your end and win again to get a point!

There are various styles of categories.

Simple categories (Animals, places, food...) result in games only a few minutes long (and suitable for playing with children in an educational environment).

Specialist categories (novels/films, brands, celebrities, games...) allow one player to show off their specialist knowledge against multiple opponents.

Meta categories (number of syllables, number of letters, rhymes...) require quick thinking and almost entirely eschew general knowledge entirely.

This was the winner of the 2017/2018 Wibbell++ design competition and is the 8th 'core game' for the Wibbell++ deck. Rules will be freely available online on 1st August 2019.

Name: Šurpu turpu
Description:
Šurpu turpu (Back and forth) - the game about touring in Latvia.

Did you know there were underground lakes in Latvia? In which forests and swamps are the most exciting walking trails? In this game you will have the opportunity not only to find out about a number of interesting places in Latvia, but also to travel in your own way. You can use boats, trains, and even airplanes to travel, if you have enough tickets for it; if you don't, you'll have to stick to your feet. But watch out for other travelers. They are likely to put obstacles in place to be the first to travel Latvia!
—description from publisher (translated)

The game area is a map of Latvia, its territory is divided into 4 historical counties with a total of 60 viewing objects connected to different roads - pedestrians, railways, rivers and air. Each viewing object have its own information card with a description of it and a small bonus that the player receives after visiting it. To win, you have to visit 4 objects, one by one in each county, and complete the end-of-game task that the players roll out at the beginning of the game.

On his own move, a player can move on the card for up to 3 steps. Pedestrian roads are free, others need tickets. They can be obtained by stopping on a blank, unnumbered field. In the same way, you can get opportunity cards that can be played before you go, helping yourself or interfering with other players.

—user summary

Name: Solorius
Description:
User summary''
Solorius (ã‚½ãƒ­ãƒªã‚¦ã‚¹) is a game from South Korea.

Will you overcome the temptation of love and remain single for the rest of your life, becoming the brightest star in Solorius?

Name: Würdest du lieber ...?
Description:
Would they rather run naked across the marketplace or spend a week in total darkness? Would you like to attend a carsting show that all your friends see or spend a night with a person you do not like?

This card game provides answers to franchises that you've never set yourself up to, opening up completely new insights into yourself and your fellow players. A player draws two cards and has to choose one, while the other player must try to guess which of the two cards the player has chosen. if he guesses correctly he gets a point and whoever could collect the most points wins.

Name: Gamergate: The Card Game
Description:
A two player adversarial game, you’ll compete with the Social Justice Warriors trying to get away with egregious breaches of ethics before Gamergate can create enough of a fuss and social pressure to expose them, all the while flaming each other on Twitter, screaming for attention and being trolled hard. Gamergate the Card Game, is a trick taking game that is played in rounds. Once an "Ethics Breech" card has been drawn then the two sides take turns playing cards trying to score greater numbers than the other player. Once the the round is over then the player with the higher score wins the "ethics breech" (trick). The player with the higher number of tricks wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Black Card Revoked
Description:
A fun and nostalgia-filled game celebrating American black popular culture. It's bound to invoke hilarious debates among young and old alike. Don't get your black card revoked!

Plays up to 6 people 
Includes 81 question cards
24 response cards. 
Safe for family play (Yes, you can play with grandma!)

One player reads a question with multiple choice questions, A-D. The others put down a card indicating the choice they believe is correct. Players start with 10 points and lose a point for every incorrect answer.

Expansions: Jollof and Fufu, Our First Family, Old School, Old School 2, Girls Night Out, Saved & Sanctified (purple), Saved & Sanctified II (orange), Black History, Petty, Still Petty, Extra player response cards.

Name: Sixteen
Description:
SET UP
    


Each player takes one shield. Fold the wings of the shield and stand it in front of you.
After putting all the tiles in the pocket, mix them well and split them equally among the players.(22 pieces each for 4 people)
When playing with 3 players, each player takes 29 tiles and leave the remaining 1 tile in the pocket. The tiles taken from the pocket are taken inside the shield. Cover the tiles well and turn them all over so other players can't see them. 
If the game is played by 2 players, place all 5 colored “1” tiles in the center of the table and put all remaining tiles in the pocket and mix well. Each person takes 30 tiles from the pocket. Leave the remaining tiles in the pocket and do not use them. Then, hide all the tiles in the shield so that other players can’t see them and turn them all over.
If you put the tiles of the same color together, it will be helpful for you to play the game.


         STARTING SETTING
    


- 4 Players : 22 Tiles
- 3 Players : 29 Tiles
- 4 Players : 30 Tiles


        GOAL OF THE GAME
    


Every tile you own is your negative score. The goal of Sixteen is to put down all the tiles you own first, or leave the fewest number of tiles. Tiles can be placed one color per turn, and must be placed in a higher number (in ascending order) than the number of tiles placed at the very end. You can also create an opportunity to remove remaining tiles by using 16END and 16RESTART tiles and special tiles such as scissors and trash cans. Make strategies by predicting other player’s remaining tiles.


         SPECIAL TILES
    


- 16 RESTART(5 : 1 per color) : You can restart the row by resetting the row of that color to the number '1'. Place a tile and pass the turn to the next player.
- 16 END(5 : 1 per color) : You can finish the row of that color. 16END tiles can be removed with scissors or trash bin tiles, but you cannot place 16RESTART tiles.
- Scissor tile(2) : You can remove one of the last tiles in a row. After removing it, you can place the tile one more time. You can only place the tile on the row that you used scissor tiles, or you can use scissor tiles only. Place the removed tiles and used scissor tiles separately next to the table.
- Trash Bin Tiles(1) : You can discard as many tiles as you like, except for tile '1' in a row. You can place the tile one more time after discarding it. You can only place the tile once more on the line where you used the trash can tile, or you can use the trash can tile only. Put the discarded tiles and the used trash can tiles separately next to the table.


         PLAYING THE GAME
    


If there is a tile with the number '1', place it all in the center of the table. The game is played clockwise starting with the player with the red number '1' tile. In the case of 2 players, a random player will be selected to start the game.
When it's your turn, you can place down a tile once. Only tiles of one color can be placed down at a time. Each color of tiles with a number greater than the number of tiles placed at the end (in ascending order) can be placed. You cannot place a tile with a number smaller than the number of tiles placed at the end.
If the ascending order conditions are satisfied, tiles can be laid down in two ways.
(Default) : Place a larger number of tiles than the one placed at the end
(Group) : Lay down a group of consecutive tiles


         END OF THE GAME
    


There are two ways to end a game. If either of them applies, the game ends immediately.
First, if a player has laid down all of their tiles, the game ends immediately and that player wins.
Second, if all players yell ‘PASS’ in one round, the game ends and the player with the lowest score wins.

[How to calculate points]
All the player remove theirs shield and add the number of tiles they have left.
For any remaining 16 END and 16RESTART tiles, add 16 points. For scissors and trash bin tiles add 20 points each.
Consecutive tiles must be in ascending order. If there is no break in the middle, the number of tiles can be placed down at once without a limit. 16END and 16RESTART can also be put down in groups. However, you can't lay down two 16 tiles at once. (Yes. You cannot put down 16END after 16RESTART in one turn)

After putting down the 16END and 16RESTART tiles, hand over the turn to the next player. After using scissors and trash can tiles, you can place down tiles of the corresponding color one more time, and this action is optional and not required. Scissors and trash can must be used until the game ends. If you don't use them and keep them till the end of the game, you get -20 points.

“Pass” if there are no tiles that can be put down in your turn. When your turn comes back, if there's a tile you can put down, put the tile down again and hand over the turn to the next player. The game continues until all players yell PASS or one player has put down all of the tiles they had.

If  the calculation is over, the player with the lowest score wins.

If there is a tie, compare the number of tiles and the one with fewer tiles wins.
Ex) When 2 people are tied for the 1st place (19 points), the number of their tiles is compared. The 1PLAYER has 3 tiles, and the 2PLAYER has 2 tiles. Therefore, the 2PLAYER who has 1 less tile wins.


         Contact Publisher
    


MAGICBEANGAMES(Republic of Korea)
e-mail : magicbean@magicbeangame.com

Name: Cuckoo Eggs
Description:
→ Board in colors suited to the colors of the balls
→ Two sets of balls – each has 16 balls of the same color

Basic Rules
Each move consist of putting one of your ball to the board (put) and pushing one of your active ball so it will move one field (push). At the end you check for the lines, than for the triangles (pull).

Goal of the game is to capture oponent balls. 
You can achieve that in three different ways:

Catch the opponent's ball using your 3 balls arranged in the form of a triangle (triangle). If the opponet’s ball is not active it is considered as sucesfully surrounded and it is removed from the board. 
    Push one of the ball outside the board (point) – pushed out ball will be taken by the player who did that move. If this is opponent ball it is considered as captured and it is removed from the game. In case player pushed out his own ball it will go back to his “hand” and can be added to the board again in future.
    Through the line alignment of the at least five balls in their own color (line).
       a. A line of five balls – opponent gives away three balls of his choice
       b. A line of six balls – opponent gives away six balls of his choice
       c. A line of seven balls – this ends game instantly by glorious win

—description from the designer

Name: Miraris: Fallen Soul
Description:
Fallen Soul (è½ã¡ãŸé­‚) is a promo card for Miraris distributed starting at some events in 2018, such as "Domina Collection" held on 12/23 at Yellow Submarine in Akihabara.

This role card has the number zero, meaning it acts before the cards in the main set. It is worth ten points on its own, and has you pick another role card at random and follow the rules for that card.

—user summary

Name: Ultimate Music Trivia Quiz
Description: Trivia quiz game with four categories - pop, rock, movie soundtracks & hits of the 80’s.

Name: Siege: Clan War
Description:
The Scorpion Clan has been dissolved. The Lion Champion has been disgraced. The Emperor lies dying of the plague, and the Great Clans eye the throne with jealous spirits. It is an age of duty, and age of honor, and age of ambition, and an age of war. It is the era of the great Clan War. The Black Scrolls are being opened, and the forces of the Shadowlands have forged an alliance with ancient enemies among the Crab in an attempt to gain entrance into the Empire. 
Who will emerge victorious at the most famous battles in history? Who will defend Rokugan, and who will see it fall?

Siege: Clan War takes us back in time to the era of the Great Clan War! The Black Scrolls are being opened and soon Fu Leng shall be released on the Empire. Come together with other players to defeat a dark god. During this time of political treachery and military honor you are called to lead the Siege on the Throne Room and vanquish Fu Leng if your army has the capability to overcome the physical and mental challenges that lay ahead of you.

Features:

Multiplayer format, pitting 3+ players against one.
New way to discover Rokugan and the world of Legend of the Five Rings.
Relive the defining era in the history of the game as part of the celebration of 20 years of L5R.
Fantastic art from fan favorite artists such as Jason Behnke, Sergio Camarena, Charles Urbach, Mario Wibisono and more!

—description from the publisher
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Party & Co: Pick One
Description:
Challenge your friends with Party & Co Pick One, the most daring party!

In this new version of the game you put your friends to the test and you get to know them from a whole other side! Use your senses or test that of your fellow players.

Do you recognize your friends by their smell? And who can not tickle? With the various assignments and game accessories you will be thoroughly tested!
—description from the publisher (translated)

Daag jouw vrienden uit met Party & Co Pick One, het meest gewaagde feest!

In deze nieuwe uitvoering van het spel stel je jouw vrienden op de proef en leer je ze van een hele andere kant kennen! Gebruik jouw zintuigen of test die van je medespelers.

Herken jij jouw vrienden aan hun geur? En wie kan er niet tegen kietelen? Met de verschillende opdrachten en spelaccessoires worden jullie flink getest!

—description from the publisher (Dutch)

Name: Cartoon Crusaders
Description:
One 52 card poker card sized deck needed for 2 players to play!

     Attack Cards
     Defense Cards
     Instant Abilities
     Player Equipment Cards 


Shuffle the deck, put in the middle of the table.  DOMINATE!!
 In a game of Skill vs. Luck. vs. Skill.... try to best your opponent. You have 20 health, he has 20 health.... Be the last one standing planning your attacks, and setting defense properly, all while playing out of the same deck of cards!!

Name: 21st Century Trivia Game
Description: Trivia game with more recent trivia questions. Players need to answer two questions from each category before anyone else.

Name: Piment fort
Description:
From the publisher:
"Laissez libre cours à votre imagination! Tentez d'être le plus drôle en complétant les énoncés proposés par l'animateur et accumulez le plus de cartes PIMENT FORT pour remporter la partie."

Name: Muumipeikko ja ystävät
Description: Find the missing items in this fun variation on a memo game. The first player to collect three correct tiles wins the games. Teaches children shapes, colours and numbers. The colourful content also makes learning fun.

Name: Redaktion Wadenbeisser: Die Jagd nach der Titelstory
Description:
The players are reporters for a school magazine and try to catch the newest „title story“ for it.
So they chase through the city trying to be the first.
The game comes with two game modes.
1. players play clockwise and either collect cards or play them and collect tokens from the board matching the color of the blueprint of their story. When one of the three parts of the story is full, they look at the card for ca. 30 seconds and try to memorize as much as possible.
They are asked a question in the vein of „what is the kid in the background eating?“ and if they guess it right they keep the card.
The first to collect enough tokens and to answer the three cards correctly wins.

2. there are 8 decks of cards available and the players take a deck and search for cards that point in the right direction in their own player color, they program simultaneously their path through the city and try to get to the colored tokens. In player order they check if they collect enough tokens to try to answer a question.
When all three cards are fulfilled the player who has all three cards in front of himself wins.

—user summary

Name: Llamas in Pyjamas
Description:
In Llamas in Pyjamas, players take turns to take a card from the pile and try to match llama pyjama tops with pyjama bottoms. Collect more pyjama bottoms, match a pyjama top to existing pyjama bottoms, and complete as many llamas as possible before all of the “bedtime scene” cards are revealed.

Watch out for those “a-llama clock” cards which can send half of a completed llama to the discard pile.

The winner is the player with the greatest number of complete llamas at bedtime.

Name: Little Collect
Description:
This children's game teaches the basics of set collection.

On a player's turn, players draw a card and take the corresponding action:
If the card depicts a carrot, the player adds a carrot to their player board. 
If the card depicts a set of peas, the player adds a pea to their player board.
If the card depicts a bunny eating a carrot, and the player already has at least one carrot, the player adds a bunny to their player board.
If the card depicts a bunny eating a pea, and the player already has at least one pea, the player adds a bunny to their player board.
If the card depicts a fox, and the player has at least one bunny on their player board, then the player must return one bunny to the supply.

Players take turns drawing cards until one player has 3 carrots, 3 peas, and 3 bunnies on their player board, and that player then wins.
—user summary

A collection game: The little rabbits are greedy and if you want to approach them, you will first need to harvest some peas and carrots! But watch out for the fox who's on the prowl! Will you be the first to fill your board? A first collecting game to play with your Mum or Dad!
—description from the back of the box

Name: Minute Challenge
Description:
Have you got what it takes to complete five one-minute long challenges? Choose to take on a mentally difficult or physically demanding challenge, and beat the timer to win!

From star jumps and hopping to naming zoo animals and remembering shopping lists, this game is sure to get your mind thinking and heart pumping!

Name: Critical Mass: Sentinel Drone
Description:
A promo card available during Man vs Meeple 2018 Kickstarter.

Equipment / Tech 2

Text: Your missile weapons gain +1 firepower. If you would have to disable a piece of equipment, you may disable this card instead.

Name: TOKYO✖CROSSING
Description: Cross the famous Shibuya intersection first with all of your pieces to win TOKYOâœ–CROSSING. Each player has three types of pieces — ninja, otaku, and high school girl — and each piece moves differently. Try to block others while getting across the street yourself!

Name: This War of Mine: Boardgame Room
Description:
Promo card from the Man vs. Meeple Season 2 Kickstarter Campaign.

Setup:
Place this card on the board instead of any chosen furniture.

(Any number of characters at the same time)

Roll a black die twice for each character here. If the total result is higher than 10, lower misery of character by 1. If lower than 10, raise misery if character by 1.

After the first roll, you may choose not to roll a second time to avoid change to misery.
Families: Game: This War of Mine (Awaken Realms)

Name: Whistle Stop: VS Promo Tile
Description:
Was available from Man vs Meeple Season 2 Kickstarter campaign.

Also contained in Whistle Stop: PAX Promo Pack

Gear tile

Score 1 point for each train of other players' colors when you arrive in a black hex that has one or more tains from other players already there.

Name: Legion: Champions of Valdyria
Description:
Legion: Champions of Valdyria is a two-player card game in which each player takes the role of a Champion, the most powerful of the leaders within their respective faction. Call upon character cards as reinforcements, arm them with powerful items, and show your tactical brilliance through well-timed events. Claim victory by fighting your way through the enemy hordes and defeat the Champion that leads them.

—description from the designer

Name: Train Heist: Calamity Promo Card
Description:
A promo card given out during Man Vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign 2018.

Setup:
Place this card above train car B (off of the board)
Place the train heist goal marker 5-10 points higher than usual.

Entering the Calamity:
For one heist action, enter via the top of the train car below the Calamity.

When aboard the Calamity:
For one heist action, you may give (or trade) cards to any one player in or on a train car immediately below the Calamity, including the jail coal car.

For one heist action, you may move the Calamity left or right to be above any other train car (2 through 5).

For one heist action, you may return loot tiles to the Calamity for 1 point apiece, putting them in the loot bag. Then, draw one new loot tile for each you returned. Place each new tile in an available loot tile space of your choice.

Name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Man vs Meeple Duke Promo Cards
Description:
2 Duke promo cards that were packaged together and offered during the Man vs Meeple Season 2 Kickstarter Campaign.

Shuffle the cards into the Duke deck at the start of the game and proceed as usual.

Drakkenstrike: At the end of the game you score 1 VP for each helmet, 2 VP for each Domain, and 1 VP for every 4 resources.

Waybright the Wise: At the end of the game you score 1 VP for each hammer, 2 VP for each Domain, and 1 VP for every 4 resources.

Name: Ortho 4x4
Description:
This is the 4x4 version of the game Match 3+. It consists of 24 cards. There are four colours and four shapes. The colours are Blue, Red, Yellow, and green, and the shapes are Square, Circle, Triangle, and Diamond. Sixteen cards have coloured shapes, four cards have colours without shapes, and four cards have shapes without colour.
Each of the two players gets 12 cards. In turns, the players play a card with either the same shape or the same colour as the one played last on the pile.
When the players have no valid card to play, they pass.
When both players pass, the one who passed first can start afresh, playing any card s/he chooses.
Only a card with the same shape can be played on a card with a colourless shape.
Only a card with the same colour can be played on a card with a shapeless colour.
The winner is the player who first empties his/her hand.

—user summary

Name: 5 Gold Rings
Description:
Based on the ITV show, 5 Gold Rings is the game where knowing the answer is not enough - you've got to put a ring on it.

Answer questions by placing gold rings onto large images displayed in the games arena. Each level is worth more money, and the rings get smaller each time. The team that performs the best takes control of the final, where there can be only one winner.

Name: Rodzinki
Description:
Jak rosnÄ… zwierzÄ™ta?
KaÅ¼de zwierzÄ…tko ma mamÄ™ i tatÄ™. Najpierw jest dzieckiem, potem roÅ›nie, zmienia siÄ™ i samo staje siÄ™ mamÄ… albo tatÄ…... Obrazki umieszczone w pudeÅ‚ku przedstawiajÄ… kolejne etapy rozwoju oÅ›miu gatunków zwierzÄ…t. MÅ‚odszym dzieciom proponujemy ukÅ‚adankÄ™, starszym – ciekawÄ…, dynamicznÄ… grÄ™.

Tile game with animal theme. For younger players it is essentially a Memory-type game and the one who completes their sets first is the winner. For older players it has additional educational value and the winner is determined based on their accumulated points.

Name: Tęczowy zamek jednorożców
Description:
TÄ™czowy zamek jednoroÅ¼ców

LeÅ›ne zwierzÄ™ta usÅ‚yszaÅ‚y niesamowite historie o magicznych stworzeniach – jednoroÅ¼cach. Nic wiÄ™c dziwnego, Å¼e kaÅ¼dy w lesie zamarzyÅ‚ o piÄ™knej, tÄ™czowej grzywie, magicznym rogu, czarowaniu i pomaganiu innym. Stara legenda gÅ‚osiÅ‚a, Å¼e Å›miaÅ‚ek, który przejdzie przez las i dojdzie do tÄ™czowego zamku – stanie siÄ™ jednoroÅ¼cem. Na peÅ‚nÄ… przygód wyprawÄ™ zdecydowaÅ‚y siÄ™ wybraÄ‡: lisica Kornelia, niedÅºwiedzica Zofia, sowa Matylda, jeÅ¼ Stefan, zajÄ…c Ignacy, jeleÅ„ Zenon. Na czubek gÅ‚owy kaÅ¼de z nich ubraÅ‚o imitacjÄ™ rogu oraz grzywy jednoroÅ¼ca i ruszyÅ‚y w drogÄ™…

Spin and move game for kids with a castle and unicorn theme. The first part is roaming the board and collecting items needed to get into the unicorn castle. While in the castle, the players need to collect the jewels and get to the finishing line.

Name: Duels of Cartisora
Description:
You enter the pits of Cartisora with confidence.  Your opponent faces you at the far side of the sandy fighting field, weapons brandished, brow furrowed.  Looks like a worthy opponent, but you don’t let your admiration show.  You release your weapon and let out an intimidating battle cry.

Only one of you will leave the battle pit alive …

A shotgun card game based on infamous warriors of their time.  Quick to set-up and easy to play — a perfect interlude and travel game.

—description from the designer

Name: Super Burger Game
Description:
Super Burger Game is a game in which players have to make a Burger filled with cards. Everyone takes turns, and the one who puts the bun on top of the stack, takes the finished Burger itself.

When each player has a Burger, the game ends. All cooks count the stuffing in their dishes, and the player with the most cards wins! That is, putting a bun on top of the deck as early as possible is not always the right strategy. However, it is possible to miss the point...

Among the edible cards you can get a fly-throw it to your opponent, and the pest will eat one card from the Burger every turn. To get rid of flies, you can use boxes or hot peppers.

—user summary
